title: 一人一封信 促教育局/學校停課

replies.msg:
希望大家可以將以下內容spam畀教育局/各大學校email

Today (11/11/2019), chaos erupted across Hong Kong as protestors took to the streets to reiterate their demands. It has been 22 weeks since the first large scale protest was staged, and yet, the government has continually ignored the people's demands and attempted to curb protests by unnecessarily violent methods, resulting in a number of injuries, and even deaths.

Just earlier today, several police officers fired live ammunition point-blank at protestors, and a police officer even attempted to run protestors over using his motorcycle. These events are a testament to the fact that Hong Kong is no longer safe, and the police no longer exists to protect the people. In fact, they pose a threat to the people's safety.

As educators, it is a responsibility to safeguard students . Therefore, I hope that schools can suspend classes and remind students to stay safe at home. No matter your stance, as an educator, you have the obligation to look out for your students; their safety should be paramount, their wellbeing should be in your best interest. It is evident that the police is completely unhinged and blatantly indifferent about the people's safety.

I urge all schools to suspend classes indefinitely until peace is restored.

Yours faithfully,
A Hong Konger.
